website_summaries.verdict: This is an eco-friendly, CFC-free, lead-free and high-energy efficiency portable air conditioner that uses an activated carbon filter.
pros: Dual hose system, includes extendable exhaust and intake hoses and window kit
cons: Auto-drain function based on environmental humidity, and does not always work in high humidity

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still kicking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit over 3 years ago and it's still blowing cold air reliably. It is easy to set up in the summer and easy to disconnect for winter storage. I use this unit to cool my living room and dining room, and it works very well... especially when I close the doors to all the bedrooms and bathrooms; it helps keep all the cool air where I want it. The exhaust fan is a little loud, so I have to notch up the volume on the tv to properly "Netflix and chill."
customer_reviews.author: Shenry

customer_reviews.title: I feel helpless
customer_reviews.text: Over $400 machine broke after few uses and the warranty does not cover the it's shipment to be fixed or send a technician to my house. The machine is so heavy that I can't pick it up and I have to ship it back to California plus they have a horrible customer service. Very very disappointed and thinking on trashing it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pinard

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: I just got it and my first impression is its great. I've had a Wynter ARC-14S for several years and this one cools better and used less electricity. I put both on a kill-o-watt and this one draws 1 amp less. My ARC-14S does need to be taken apart and cleaned so that could explain why it doesn't cool as well. This one is a little noisier, but not too bad. One thing I really dont like are all the led's on the front. I wish there was an option to turn them off. I have to tape a piece of cardboard over them to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Sprocket

customer_reviews.title: Portable A/C Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: We used it in our bedroom and it cooled the room so we were comfortable. It was especially helpful during hot days that were smoky from the wild fires. It is somewhat noisy but placing a mat underneath the unit on the hardwood floors and using the fan on the lowest setting helped. When we put it away for fall/winter the packing instruction on the cover were helpful. It's heavy so we store it in a corner in the same bedroom. We are happy we made the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Balmadrid

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy!
customer_reviews.text: After some research, I purchased this one for a friend who lives in an RV. There is no AC in the rear toy hauler compartment where she keeps her cats. Not only does it keep that area cool but on 100+ degree days, it keeps the entire trailer cooler than just the main AC. She is extremely happy with it. We mounted the hose bracket on a piece of plywood cut out to match her RV's unique window shape. That is held in place on the window with clips from the hardware store. Don't waste your time with single hose units. These portables with dual hoses are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGal

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought a single hose Sunpentown portable AC a few years ago and it never seemed to blow that cold. Determined to find a replacement that would deliver I started reading the Amazon reviews. If you're doing the same you've probably read a lot of comments that recommend you go for the dual hose. I'm here to tell you that is absolutely the GOSPEL truth. This Whytner is incredibly effective. Like every AC, it's loud and has recently developed a vibration. Last night I discovered that strategically placing a couple heavy objects inside of the top vent (in this case a couple pinballs on the plastic grate) muffled my most annoying rattle.
customer_reviews.author: 3MTA3

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cool my master bedroom (10 ft x 17 ft w/cathedral ceiling). Works very effectively. Not too loud. Size was a little bit bigger than I was expecting but not a problem for my spacing. The LED light on front is blue and is bright at night. I taped a piece of cardboard over the face as I prefer sleeping in a dark room. Window mount and intake and exhaust tubing was fairly simple to install. I was able leave the screen on the window in place to provide a barrier for insects. Shipping was efficient with no damage. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: 3K in water damage!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit for 2 months and it decided to leak causing $3000 worth of damage. Theres a tube inside at the top that was a steady leak and would pool up on the bottom of the unit, I had a drain tube hooked up but the water wasnt able to flow through the tube because it was leaking out of screw holes on the bottom tray!!! Poor design, will not buy another!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Robb

customer_reviews.title: Whynter 12SD A/C Unit ....AMAZING!!!!!!!!! ICE COLD!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had about 4 different Portable A/C Units and this Whynter 12sd is the Best. It gets SUPER COLD!!!!!!! Removes a Ton of moisture from the air. It a rather large and heavy unit. I also wish the top Vent had more adjustment and was automatic. Aside from that, this unit is GREAT !!!!!!!!!. Now i know why it is in the Top 5 Portable A/C Units of 2016 List..
customer_reviews.author: Samuel G.

customer_reviews.title: customer support
customer_reviews.text: To beat the heat I purchased this Whynter's a/c unit. I was over seas when it arrived. The purchased required some customer support to replace some missing parts so that I could intall the unit and utilize it. Allie F. from Whynter was fantastic. She carefully listened to the details of my purchase order and was very thorough in her execution to resolve the issue. I had been on the phone with several agents but she specifically handle the situation with clarity to ensure I will have a working unit. I am grateful. Sincerely, Amanda Snow
customer_reviews.author: amanda snow

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I can not sleep when it's hot. And our master bedroom is on the top floor, opposite side of where he AC unit is located. Needless to say, it was always hot in our room. This fixed all problems. Our room is 18'x20' and is very cool within 20 minutes of turning this unit on at night. It is hardly noticable from the outside, which is great if you live in an association that frowns upon "un-sightly items." It is a little louder than a box fan, but definitey worth the trade off. It's slightly larger than our dehumidifiers.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry R. Drake II

customer_reviews.title: Really good air conditioner
customer_reviews.text: We bought this last year, good thing because this summer has been really hot in New York, many days going over 90 and feels like 100 something. This unit has been a life saver for us, keeps us cool and comfortable even when the temps are soaring. We bought a portable one about 10 years ago for $900 from PC Richards (one hose). Still works but we have to empty the water after a while. The technology is definitely better now (2 hoses) no water emptying. Only con was that it came with a little dent on the side, but that didn't affect the performance. This is a really cool AC. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Stein

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Sacto, we fry here in the summer. So as not to jack up the bill to cool the whole hse, I installed this badboy in my living room, where I am at night, and it's hottest in the evening. Used a shower rod and a very nice heavy velvet curtain to enclose the room. OMG! What a gem. The outside temp. cools down overnite, so I open all the windows b 4 I go to bed, and it's cool in the house by morning! My energy bill is cut in half! Will b buying a similar, smaller unit for my bedroom this year.
customer_reviews.author: 1goddess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I just installed one of these at my mother-in-law's home. We are all very pleased with it. I had to do a custom installation through the wall to the garage. If you need to install through a wall, hint - ditch the window/patio door slider part and get a couple of 8" recessed lighting trims with 5" openings, adjust as necessary for the 4 tabs on the fixture plate. It works great and looks clean and professional. The unit operates flawlessly. Noise levels are very agreeable and it cools really well. Unit and components all are well made. No complaints about this at all.
customer_reviews.author: jarea

customer_reviews.title: Super cool
customer_reviews.text: We needed an AC fix for our two story family room that was open to the second floor one summer. We were quoted $6-8,000 to replace our system and being a month away from colder weather we decided to wait until the next spring. This unit was unbelievably capable of cooling our main floor which is around 2,500 square feet and completely open to the upper floor. If you need it for an apartment I think you would be very pleased at how cool it gets.
customer_reviews.author: bleary eyed mom

customer_reviews.title: Dual pipes AC
customer_reviews.text: a little noise when the room at hi temp but will go down when the room getting closer to the setting temp. Plus side is dual pipes; don’t want the hot air release in the room after process thru the system. worth to spend $~50 for that option! so far so good after 1 week use.
customer_reviews.author: SiTG

customer_reviews.title: Do your research before you click checkout
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received didn't function when turned on and everything was installed properly. The limited time that I had with it; the user interface,UI, is difficult to use and isn't straight forward like other popular brand units.
customer_reviews.author: zlNep

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cooling bedroom!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a bedroom. House has central air but bedroom is still hot. No sense keeping entire house at 65 so bedroom is 70. Works great. Set it 1/2 hr before bed and room is perfect temperature all night. Some noise, but all air conditioners have noise. Easy installation, easy operation. Yes, it does have a light on the front of it for easy read, but when you're asleep who cares. If you need an air conditioner and don't want a heavy window one, try this. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: dawneiegirl

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: We had an especially hot summer where I live in New England. The second floor was unbearable without air conditioning. We bought a mini-split unit for our bedroom but the hotter it got outside the worse the mini-split performed. This unit in combination with the mini-split was able to keep our 1000 sq ft second floor cool. My one complaint is that it leaks water on the floor making it necessary to purchase a mat to collect the moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this AC unit for two months and so far so good. I do wish it had cooler air output, but it does lower the temperature in my living room by at least 5 degrees even though my living room space is big (about 450 sq feet). It's a little bit noisy, but its a great dehumidifier, it takes the stuffiness out. The water reservoir never overfills. Another thing i don't like its that it shoots the air up instead of forward like others units i have seen. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: risitas

customer_reviews.title: Decent air conditioner
customer_reviews.text: It's massive and loud, but it did keep the bedroom cool to 68 degrees during a massive heat wave when it was 90 degrees out.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: HAd to pay over $100 to ship this item back to the company
customer_reviews.text: Unit failed within 3 months, had to pay out of pocket to ship this item back and have it repaired. I'd recommend a company that actually stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Efficient cooling, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient cooling compared to what we had before. No complaints at all after one summer season. I wish the control electronics was a bit more useful. All you can do is set a time (in full hours) from now for when you want the unit to turn on (or off if it's already running). But that's enough for what we use it for. I recommend you review whether the size and weight work for what you need, it's quite large and heavy - not really "portable", but then again you need to hook it up semi-permanently anyway with its hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: Extremely noisy, even when following troubleshooting guidelines
customer_reviews.text: Unit is extremely noisy. Troubleshoot section of the manual says that it the unit could be (1) on an uneven surface, (2) not level or (3) that low power voltage that is causing the issue of noise. I had a window AC unit connected to the same outlet without any issues, the AC is completely level and it's on an even surface. It might be an issue with the fan, but at this point, I'm thinking about returning it. Perhaps someone has any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: P. Carbuccia

customer_reviews.title: Why 2 hoses?
customer_reviews.text: I've used the unit for 5 weeks. I use it just for cooling and it works great. It cools the room quickly, and the unit expels all of the water through the exhaust hose. It makes no more noise than a window unit would. I called the manufacturer and asked if I needed to connect the intake hose. They said no, I could allow the unit to recirculate the interior air as its being cooled. I have no idea why the unit is made with 2 hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to alleviate the extreme heat inside of one of my rooms. This particular room housed the majority of my electronic equipment. This thing sure made a difference. After about a day of running it dropped the temperature about 20 degrees. The only downside that I would place on this would be the window adapter. It wasn't quite wide enough to completely seal my window (it missed the mark by about 4 inches). A simple fix of a piece of wood cut to size and some duct tape fixed it up nicely though.
customer_reviews.author: Gillermo Montoya

customer_reviews.title: I expected it to work Great and cool down my livingroom
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews I selected this Unit. I expected it to work Great and cool down my livingroom, but I was disappointed. My livingroom has too many windows and gets very Hot. This unit just cant keep up. I previously had a 9000btu unit and thought that upgrading to this one would work... I was wrong. I am sure it would work great in a small room that doesn't get much sun.
customer_reviews.author: Ideaguy

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic AC.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic AC cools the room very quickly and it is very quite. The duel hose system is really is much more efficient than a single hose type. The display is user friendly and remote works well. I really like this unit much better than my old portable AC witch gave up the ghost and had to be replaced. I highly recommend this you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Rock N Roll

customer_reviews.title: If you want COLD this is the one to get !!
customer_reviews.text: Better than my window ac and gets real cold which is what I wanted, hoses are on the short side and it does fill the water bucket which has to be dumped twice a day, but I'm not complaining because it's great to be able to sleep when the temperature outside is in the Texas 100's and the temperature in my bedroom is in the 60's. Thank you for making a great AC, because years ago I purchased another brand which was only one hose and it was useless so I was nervous to get another portable ac, so I did my homework and research I made the right selection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! i have only used it in one room
customer_reviews.text: Works great ! i have only used it in one room, but the hottest room in the house and when it is Over 100 outside, cools the room to 84 easily and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: midnt7star

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Set it up and had it working in 15 minutes. Just had to add a drain 1/2 gallon bucket to catch the condensation. I added a drain clear tubing, and a female 90 to screw into the upper drain outlet to avoid the unit shutting off when the original tank was full. This way I can empty the bucket and not have to move the unit. It is used in our master bedroom area. It is covering about 300 square feet and pulls the temp down in 30 minutes. It was a great buy and don't have to run the central AC.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P. Thorp

customer_reviews.title: Very good portable air conditioner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little air conditioner. Works very well in our large master bedroom. If you don't need the whole house to be cool and don't want to shell out thousands of dollars for a whole house system, this is the way to go. We've had it for 2 summers and it performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Im much cooler
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area with summers in the 100s. This unit work wonderful and keeps two rooms cool. It’s doing an awesome job. Just be prepared it is heavy to move.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Really Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The air conditioner stopped working on the second day after only light use on the first day. I was really looking forward to this item after reading all of the reviews and seeing its performance on the first day. Now the fan doesn't work and the compressor basically cools the heat exchanger and doesn't transfer it to the air. Now I have to repackage this GIANT thing and get it ready for shipment. Would be easier dealing with a local brick and mortar store.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Amazon reviewers. Your input led me to this dual hose model. Arrived quickly at my door, very well packaged, slight adjustment to the window kit and I'm up and running. Runs C O L D and more than adequately cools my space. No louder than a window unit.
customer_reviews.author: ...mythoughts.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that it doesn't cool better
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that it doesn't cool better. 12,000 BTU should cool 308 sq ft. Maybe returning this. On the flip side of this, very easy to setup and operate.
customer_reviews.author: SJW

customer_reviews.title: Recommended with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: The unit is working well. I find emptying the tanks a fiddly business. I can not sleep with the unit on; it makes too much noise.
customer_reviews.author: BigRings

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & efficient
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet but efficient portable air conditioner. It's a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable AC unit!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this AC unit in my office. Good stuff! I highly recommend it! 👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Lee

customer_reviews.title: It does keep the room cool but man is it loud
customer_reviews.text: This is a really big unit and it's loud. It would be as loud as a window unit. It does keep the room cool but man is it loud. You would not be able to hear a TV in the room if you had this going. It is nice to sleep by because of the sound and you become dependent on it after awhile. But really, if you could have a window unit instead, I would say by the window unit. I haven't tried to drain it because it looks heavy and complicated to do it, but it may not be.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Grace Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Love this AC
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to setup, powerful AC when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: I use it for up stairs master,house a/c cant cool second story well enough. I would never buy single hose unit again.Keeps large master room cool noise is average to other units i've owned. Room also has ceiling fan so at 76 to 77 it feels comfortable. I agree with other reviews doesnt add alot to pge bill running it when im in room.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence d nolen

customer_reviews.title: Know what you are getting
customer_reviews.text: We bought this unit to spot cool our second story bedroom, located in the HOT upper Sacramento valley. Pros: it keeps the bedroom cool enough to sleep. Set-up is fairly easy. Cons: It is noisy. The control panel lights are bright. (We had to shield them with a cardboard flap taped to the top.) A control panel light stopped functioning the third week of use. (Just the indicator light). They should have put the controls under a plastic door and used slightly dimmer indicator lights. Despite this, I would recommend this unit. Just know what you are are getting
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this thing to provide supplemental and off-season cooling to a small server room (four rack mount servers). It's no louder than the servers when it runs, but it's noticeable. The drain is at the bottom, so I've had to prop it up on risers to get it draining into the condensation pump properly. It runs almost constantly, but it handles cooling servers that are pulling over 2000W total, so I'm extremely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Left Ear of Corn

customer_reviews.title: Great portable AC unit
customer_reviews.text: Works just like advertised. Not too loud and it really cools the kitchen/dining room areas well. Pricing was great too. The only drawback is it's a little bigger and heavier than I hoped but that's fine as the good cooling makes up for the size. Only thing I wished for ( minor nits here) was that the cooling vent was more directed and rotated back and forth. Also, that the rack that holds the intake and exhaust hoses was longer so it fits in a sliding door.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Owen Donohoe

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and works very well
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and works very well. To make it truly portable, my plan was to be able to move it from my den to a spare bedroom when we had company, it should include a second window kit. You can purchase a second kit but, will have to wait weeks or months for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very large but does the trick. Note: We live in CO so the climate is dry and temps only reach 85 in the summer. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Does what advertised
customer_reviews.text: First, we purchased a Delonghi model from Costco that was on sale. 11,500 btu, but after hours of running, it failed to produce cool air flow. After retuning that model, we ordered this Whynter model. Easy to set up. Instant cool air. This is cooling a 200 sf sunroom quite well. The sound level is the same as the Delonghi, minus a tinny sound that would occasionally rear up without provocation.
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: although the controls don't seem to work like the manual states
customer_reviews.text: Chills a large room very well, although the controls don't seem to work like the manual states. I added a hose and small bucket to the drain tap because the dehumidifier works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: This workhorse has powered through two NYC summers so far ...
customer_reviews.text: This workhorse has powered through two NYC summers so far. The space is a small basement studio apartment. I've used the dual hoses in our window and been impressed with the ac and fan settings. Haven't tried to use the humidifier setting. Not sure how it would work for a larger space, but it definitely has met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good, big, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This unit was bigger than I expected. And it assembled easier than I expected....I'm not very mechanically inclined. It has the appearance of a giant bread maker or R2D2, and yep, it's pretty noisy. But it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: E. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but exceptionally noisy
customer_reviews.text: Works well on the days when it's way too hot for window fans, but sounds like a jet engine. Probably louder than a window unit (not sure).
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great after a year, not noisy, does it's job- remote and other functions make it simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: tough customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing  Unit !!
customer_reviews.text: This Whynter 12,000 BTU Dual Hose Portable Air Conditioner is Amazing in it's COOLING operation!! Quiet,smooth,fast cooling. We replaced 2 window mounts with this Whynter 12,000 Portable and it is out performing Beyond imagination!!! Better circulation, Fast Start Up Cooling, What a Difference Dual Hose systems make in overall Performance!!!! Delivered to our Living Room, 2nd Day FREE Delivery, Installation Very Simple, NO WATER LEAKS & WE LOVE THE REMOTE UNIT & it's Easy to Read Performance!!! We Have About a 1,000 sq ft. 2nd floor Apartment in MAINE. LOOKS LIKE A COMFORTABLE SUMMER FOR US!!!! THANK YOU AMAZON!!!!!!! Redhawk789
customer_reviews.author: Edward Redman

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well even on hot days...although it cools mainly the room it is in, not the rest of the apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought this ages ago!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it when a family member was coming home after surgery during a heat wave. Now I don't know why I hadn't had one all along. Does a great job of keeping the temperature nice and cool when it is over 100 degrees outside. Easy to install and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Mgmanny MtV WA

customer_reviews.title: Best A/C
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases yet...performs brilliantly, hard to beat this portable a/c. If I had to criticize, it would be the hose...could have been just a bit longer and the window bracket (should have better ones). Overall, hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sanders

customer_reviews.title: terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had for two weeks and returning it. I have a 200sq. ft. room and can not get the room temp lower than 80 degrees that is because it will not put out air that is colder than 60 degrees so I am told by manufacture. Do not waste you're time and money on this product
customer_reviews.author: Dom Jr

customer_reviews.title: Cools well, a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: This unit does a good job cooling a large room. But, it does make more noise than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and cools my master bedroom pretty fast! My bedroom is about 450 square feet so I am very happy at the cooling job this ac unit does. however it it a bit noisy but you get use to it. We had this unit for about a month and we have not recieved the warning light to change out the water. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Solid Dual Hose Portable A/C
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Might be better if you could move the vents around more. Draining the machine is slightly awkward as the plug is close to the floor. Cools a big bedroom quickly and you can set the temperature to as low as 61 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Teitelbaum

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product. Noisy but no more than any other ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Noisy but no more than any other a/c unit.
customer_reviews.author: rcp70

customer_reviews.title: ... than what we had expected but the size is perfect for the size of our house
customer_reviews.text: The A/C unit is bigger than what we had expected but the size is perfect for the size of our house. It's on wheels so it can easily be moved from one room to the next if need be, the assembly for the window portion of the unit for the hoses was easy to put together as well. It is definitely worth the price and shipping cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Favreau

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got a good Amazon Warehouse deal, came with cosmetic defects as described. Actually worked beyond expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: It's a workhorse
customer_reviews.text: She kicks out cold air and dehumidifies... Our heat pump went out on one of the hottest days. We bought this and two others slightly bigger... We have 3600 square feet house, and plan on moving so weren't into putting another 7000 into a new heat pump. We call them the big boys. And when it's 90 plus outside keeps the house between 70 -73 depending on how hot.. It's amazing. High recommendation... Easy to set up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: debbie m schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This thing just doesn't work. I had it on for hours in my insulated garage, and the temp never budged. Same as it was before I turned it on. I wish I had returned it(bought in 2015) but it was so hard to get out of the box, I just got lazy about attempting to rebox it. So now I'm out $400 plus dollars on a giant toaster that sits in my garage taking up space. Maybe I can sell it locally. Used it 4 times, then gave up hope. Looking into a split system now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Best AC I have ever had. I live in a 1 bedroom house. It may be only 4 rooms in the house, but it keeps all four cool. As long as I have fan circulating the cool air, I keep that house at 65 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Trombley

customer_reviews.title: Not only does it no longer cool, but the display is acting erratically
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in June 2013. It ceased cooling in July 2013, and I just learned I'm past the window to return it. I've used the manual to troubleshoot the problem, but nothing works -- including unplugging the unit to let it reset. Not only does it no longer cool, but the display is acting erratically. I loved it while it worked, but obviously don't like spending that amount of money for a product that failed in just over a year!
customer_reviews.author: Dee M.

customer_reviews.title: Get it now!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! Best portable A/C unit I've ever had. Cools the room in 15 to 20 minutes. Duel hoses is the way to go with these portable window unit. I've had single and now duel hose and I'd take the duel everytime now.
customer_reviews.author: mccarlton Tezeno

customer_reviews.title: Great portable air conditioner
customer_reviews.text: The unit works very well, it is able to cool a large room effectively. We didn't find it to be noisy at all at night, no more than a large fan. It is quite large in size but is tastefully designed.
customer_reviews.author: GJNW

customer_reviews.title: Box store buster..
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble/install. Really cools ,much better than those box store models... Great item.. Worth the couple day wait.. Portable..
customer_reviews.author: shane parrish

customer_reviews.title: We love this portable AC
customer_reviews.text: We love this portable AC. Easy to install and keeps the room cool. The fan function is great and really helps to circulate the air. Sleek design looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Does well cooling down the bedroom in my small apartment ...
customer_reviews.text: Does well cooling down the bedroom in my small apartment - a bit noisy but beats being hot while trying to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: but looks like it should do the job
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than I was anticipating, but looks like it should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is appalling. I am surprised and confused by all the positive reviews. The window installation kit is cheap and poorly designed. You will need to use other materials to secure it into the window. The power button BROKE the first time I used it. The unit does not turn on. I will be returning it. Although lets not forget, it weighs 60 LBS. And of course, it large, ugly and heavy. Never ever again will I be purchasing from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: great product not as powerful ad expected
customer_reviews.text: Our home is just shy of 900 sq ft and we expected it would cool the rooms sufficiently however only our living room got sir. So less powerful than expected. However, overall I do like it, very easy to use and move.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would cool a little quicker, but it still cools things down. The room it's in might be a little to big. The window exhaust was a little cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: It cools most of the first floor of the house. Does not cool as much sqft as listed. Takes up a good bit of space with the 2 hoses connected to the window vents. On high is a bit noisey
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective, Seemingly non-existent customer support
customer_reviews.text: Received the machine, followed the instructions, unit wouldn't turn on. Ran through the troubleshooting part on the manual, tried other outlets in the house, even checked the voltage to ensure proper supply. Called Whynter customer support only to get a voice mail, left a message and still 3 days later no response. I've also called 2 times since with the same results. Pathetic. Returned to Amazon for full refund, will be buying a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: Green Genes

customer_reviews.title: easy water removal solution
customer_reviews.text: The problem with the product is the difficulty in removing the water. My daughter thought of a simple solution that works perfectly. Take a gallon size plastic ziploc freezer bag. Place the back top edge of the bag under the spout and against the back surface under the spout. The water flows into the bag. The bag holds as much water as comes out. No spillage at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lauraine G Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: ...but I don't think it's a particularly good value. It did not cool as much volume or as quickly as I felt was advertised. I will look at a window unit when I am in need of a portable air conditioner in the future. The LED display is very bright and makes sleeping difficult if light bugs you like me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gift For You

customer_reviews.title: Performs well
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with plastic cover cracked and taped together. The cover is very flimsy and difficult to align in replacement. Otherwise, I am pleased with performance. It is not too noisy and cools a former attached garage which has been converted into a home gym and office. Only gets 4 Stars because of cover problems. I have owned it for one month.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this as its been very hot and humid where I live. Package arrived with no exterior damage that I could see. Waited overnight and then plugged it in. Started making a loud screeching noise. Grabbed a flashlight and looked inside. The blower motor's squirrel cage fan was broken off the motor shaft. Sending it back. Now I'm waiting for the third replacement from Amazon to get here (second one got lost in route. Third one is different brand). :(
customer_reviews.author: XJ04

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Good while working even though compressor acting up . Now completely stopped working after 2 weeks ! It's just a fan ! Such a hassle returning too because heavy and I didn't keep the box . Not good customer service from manufacturer either .
customer_reviews.author: Pokie73

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when this arrived as it's a very nice looking appliance, but unfortunately it never worked. It would not turn on at all. We tried plugging it into several sockets in the house and got nothing. I was going to try replacing it but I felt wary then. What if the replacement unit also had problems? I opted to just return it. Fortunately Amazon's return process was very efficient, so we packed it up and sent it back via UPS, and they processed my refund very quickly. So... one star for the product, but five stars for Amazon's return process, which was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Venn

customer_reviews.title: Ordered unit opened box got E2 error code out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered unit opened box got E2 error code out of the box, unit does not work. Called Whynter support in the morning they said they would send information via email, this is 24 hours later and I'm still waiting for it. I called Whynter and they said I should have it by the end of the day. I have to wait 2 days just to get a sheet of paper emailed to me to tell me how to open the unit and look for a loose connection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought it several years ago and still does great job of cooling down the room in the worst heat
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Portable Air Conditioner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit with separate air intake and exhaust tubes for our vinyl window enclosed lanai. Very pleased with it's ease of operation, easy set-up, quiet running and great cooling ability. Highly recommend it. My research says the dual tube system is better than a single intake / exhaust tube. Still awaiting my first electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J. Amrein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps temperatures down and is very quiet. Dual hose is a huge improvement over single hose models
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dahl

customer_reviews.title: It's big and bulky, but a great alternative when window units aren't allowed
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these units three years ago and it's still working great. Within a few weeks or months, the LED panel on the front stopped working, so it doesn't display the temperature, but that doesn't really affect the functionality. The problem with single hose air conditioners is they create negative pressure in the space, which means it has to replace the air from elsewhere - AKA from outside. Dual hose designs don't have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: ssbproductions

customer_reviews.title: For a standard wired house it blows the breaker if ...
customer_reviews.text: For a standard wired house it blows the breaker if you have any other appliance on such as a tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised  temperature range CANNOT REACH 61°. Timer does not work, louvers do not automatically go up or down, etc!
customer_reviews.text: If you want an air-conditioner that : • LIMITS its own temperature range CAN’T go below 66° (due to an internal “limiter”) that according to page 12 of the instruction manual “saves energy” and “extends the life of the A/C by turning off the compressor”. (The STATED temperature range is stated from 61° to 89°!) • has manual louvers-NOT automatic • Comes with broken remote, (timer doesn’t work) • Has hoses that do not fit on the connectors • Arrives in a broken box making it difficult to return... ....Then this is the PERFECT A/C for you!!! (Can’t give it zero stars that’s not an option...)
customer_reviews.author: jlk421

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and useless product. Shameful display of engineering!!
customer_reviews.text: horrible and useless product. I live in the bay area where summers are relatively cooler. This A/C compressor barely worked on the second night itself., . The temperature in the room was more than the outside. My room is less than 100 sq feet. so its a shame that the A/C was so ineffective. Plus I felt choked because of low oxygen. there was hardly any ventilation. Shameful display of engineering!! DO NOT BUY THIS. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: ujala

customer_reviews.title: doesn't cool
customer_reviews.text: dehumidifies, does not cool, pricey and not worth the price. get a window unit. these things do not work near as well as a window unit. In Texas you need a real A/C.
customer_reviews.author: former teacher

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the first one, it would not even turn on. Had it replaced, the second one at least the digital interface turned on but the fan did not work. Would never purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Did not cool my 500 square foot room
customer_reviews.text: This air conditioner did not cool my 500 square foot room. It was on for 5 hours with no result. The humidity did diminish and the room was more tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Miche

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: did not realize how big and bulky it is. takes up too much room !!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Sturtevant

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I hate to be the first one to put such a negative review. This unit has two fans I can see, one for the exhaust or intake behind the unit, and one to blow the cold air on the top. Unfortunately this latter was dead on arrival, which means the unit is completely unusable. Wife and baby are not happy as the hot summer is approaching...
customer_reviews.author: Fabien Robert Baron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit that made our 1920s house cool all summer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent unit that made our 1920s house cool all summer. Of course it couldn't cool the whole house but it was perfect for main three connected rooms (Kitchen, Dinning Room, Living Room). When the heat was really unbearable we would put this in our small bedroom and it was a godsend. For it's size, it's not too loud and our energy bill didn't increase too much (maybe 50 bucks). For two summers, it basically ran nonstop for months and never faltered once only needing an occasional water draining. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: IV

customer_reviews.title: Really crappy design with the drain
customer_reviews.text: The AC shuts off when the tank is full from, I have had that happen every 8 hours or so. The crappy design has the drain at the bottom of AC, so it's really hard to collect water from drain if AC is on the floor. And you usually spill the water from the drain if AC isn't elevated
customer_reviews.author: muhammad luqman

product_meta.title: Whynter ARC-12SD 12,000 BTU Dual Hose Portable Air Conditioner, Dehumidifier, Fan with Activated Carbon Filter plus Storage bag for Rooms up to 400 sq ft,Multi
product_meta.description: The energy-efficient Whynter ARC-12SD Dual Hose Portable Air Conditioner draws warm, humid air in and transforms it into cool and fresh air. The sleek, frost-white portable air conditioner features auto-drain technology for controlling condensation, an easy-to-install dual hose venting system, and three operational modes; cooling, fan only and dehumidifying.
feature_bullets: * AWARD WINNING : 1. Good Housekeeping's "Best Portable Air Conditioners to Buy in 2019" 2. Consumer Report's 2019 Top 2 highest Score
* Three operational modes: air conditioner, fan or dehumidifier. This unit can cool up to a 400 square feet space (ambient temperature and humidity may influence optimum performance)
* Remote control, activated carbon air filter, washable pre-filter, and product manual packaged inside exhaust hose; Noise level (dBA): <56

* Full thermostatic control (61°F - 89°F cooling) with digital readout, 24 hour programmable timer; Eco-friendly CFC free Green R-410A refrigerant; Patented auto drain function fully exhausts all condensate automatically in most environments
* Full installation set includes extendable exhaust and intake hose (up to 60") and window kit (up to 46") Max. window kit length = 46" , Min. window kit length = 20".
* Maximum power consumption: 1100 W / 10.5 A . Power supply: 115 V / 60Hz / 1 Phase; Dehumidifying capacity of 96 pints per day; 3 fan speeds; Air Flow (at high speed): 320 m3/h / 188 CFM

specifications.Warranty Description: One year on unit and three year on compressor.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars341 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
